messages.message:
New build problem:

```[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] RUNTEST OUTPUT: INFO: Writing tracer profile to '/tmp/bazel/profile-00-07653e2d4192a72418a53a78745f9288-198b8bfff8e54785-01.json'
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] INFO: Invocation ID: 134e21fd-5e0e-442f-9222-4adcc1ca3bf2
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] Loading: 
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] WARNING: Download from https://mirror.bazel.build/github.com/bazelbuild/rules_pkg/releases/download/1.1.0/rules_pkg-1.1.0.tar.gz failed: class java.io.FileNotFoundException GET returned 404 Not Found
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] Loading: 
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] Loading: 0 packages loaded
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] ERROR: error loading package 'shared-utils/build-utils/shared/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/torchgen/packaged/autograd': cannot load '//:tools/bazel.bzl': no such file
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] ERROR: error loading package 'shared-utils/build-utils/shared/.venv/lib64/python3.9/site-packages/torchgen/packaged/autograd': cannot load '//:tools/bazel.bzl': no such file
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] ERROR: error loading package under directory 'shared-utils/build-utils/shared': error loading package 'shared-utils/build-utils/shared/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/torchgen/packaged/autograd': cannot load '//:tools/bazel.bzl': no such file
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] INFO: Elapsed time: 0.515s
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] INFO: 0 processes.
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully (0 packages loaded)
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] ERROR: Couldn't start the build. Unable to run tests
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] INFO: Build Event Protocol files produced successfully.
[2025-07-16T18:09:26.412Z] FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully (0 packages loaded)```
^ looks like runtest.go trying to run a package under .venv as one of our Bazel modules

Huh, that `.venv` dir should only be getting created when there is *not* already a `VIRTUAL_ENV` env var set - then `uv` creates one in the current dir. Wonder if that dir doesn't have a `.gitignore` like it should?

Or perhaps Bazel doesn't respect them

@mfichman any job links?
I can dig that one up pretty quick I think
~Oh it might just be a command grouping bug, one sec~

Nevermind, red herring, sorry.

It's weird because `.venv` is already in `.bazelignore` at the repo root :confused_dog:
Well, if it recurs I'll look into it.

https://jenkins.instabase.com/blue/rest/organizations/jenkins/pipelines/instabase/branches/PR-72485/runs/5/nodes/43/log/?start=0
from https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72485
It is quite hard to find what failed and why in this log
